name: 陳匡正
objective: This online course will introduce theories of economic analyses and research methods. Not only does this course introduce why economic analyses are important in recent years, but also does how economic analyze all types of intellectual property rights. Contents of this course are started to discuss basic economic theories and research methods of economic analyses to further examine all fields of intellectual property rights, including copyright, patent, trademark, and trade secrets. Thus, these will achieve teaching purposes for balancing theories and practices. Students who do not have economic backgrounds are welcome to enroll this class. In fact, the class lectures will be in English 30% and in Chinese 70%, and the class materials are in Chinese.
schedule:
Week 1 (110/9/20~110/9/25) The Mid-Autumn Festival 
Week 2 (110/9/27~110/10/2) Importance of Law & Economics and Fundamental Theories of Law & Economics; Why do Lawyers Train for Law & Economics? 
Week 3 (110/10/4~110/10/9) Microeconomics; Introductions of Economic Theories for Property Law and Coase Theory
Week 4 (110/10/11~110/10/16) Which One is Efficiency?──Properties are Publicly or Privately Owned
Week 5 (110/10/18~110/10/23) Introduction of the Bargaining Theory
Week 6 (110/10/25~110/10/30) Introduction of Economic Theories for Contract Law
Week 7 (110/11/1~110/11/6) Traditional Theories of the Tort’s Liabilities 
Week 8 (110/11/8~110/11/13) Economic Theories of the Tort’s Liabilities
Week 9 (110/11/15~110/11/20) Economic Analyses of Copyright (I)
Week 10 (110/11/22~110/11/27) Economic Analyses of Copyright (II)
Week 11 (110/11/29~110/12/4) Economic Analyses of Patent (I)
Week 12 (110/12/6~110/12/11) Economic Analyses of Patent (II)
Week 13 (110/12/13~110/12/18) Economic Analyses of Trademark (I)
Week 14 (110/12/20~110/12/25) Economic Analyses of Trademark (II)
Week 15 (110/12/27~111/1/1) Economic Analyses of Trade Secrets 
Week 16 (111/1/3~111/1/8) Conclusions
Week 17 (111/1/10~111/1/15) Final Project Report (I)
Week 18 (111/1/17~111/1/22) Final Project Report (II)
scorePolicy:
1. Final Project Report in Chinese or English 50%
2. Class Attendance 30%
3. Class Participation and Performance 20%
materials:
1. Cooter, Robert & Ulen, Thomas, Law & Economics (Wen, Li-Chi & Gu, Mu-Yau trans., Hwa Tai Publishing Co. 6th ed. 2014).
2. Cooter, Robert & Ulen, Thomas, Law & Economics (Pearson Education, Inc., 2008).
3. Friedman, David D., Law’s Order: What Economics Has to Do with Law and Why It Matters (Yeh, Chia-Hsing & Hsu, Yuan-Feng trans., Prophet Press 2002).
4. Landes, William & Posner, Richard, The Economic Structure of Intellectual Property Law (Harvard University Press, 2003).
5. Law & Economics (Hsieh, Che-Sheng ed., 2007).
6. Posner, Richard, Economic Analysis of Law (Aspen Publishers, 2007).
